p: There has not yet been any scientific evidence that people living with HIV are at higher risk of contracting COVID-19 or developing severe forms of the disease. However, HIV-infected people are at higher risk of cardiovascular and/or metabolic disorders, as a consequence of chronic immune activation and ARV drugs exposure. They are more likely to contract COVID-19 and develop severe forms. With the exception of Niger (0.3%), Burkina Faso has one of the lowest rates of people living with HIV in the West African sub region (0.7%). Ivory Coast has the highest rate with 2.6% followed by Togo with 2.3%, Ghana with 1.7%, Mali with 1.4% and Benin with 1% [ 65].
